column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=I do n’t know .
#Text=In this business I am very easy to cubby hole .
#Text=As someone said to me the other day — they had seen the HBO special — and they said , “ Are you really a sad obsessed person ? ”
#Text=And I thought , “ No , I ’m not really a sad person , except when I lie awake at night in winter thinking about all the animals out without shelter , and then I ’m sad ! ”
#Text=Who would n’t be ?
#Text=Would n’t anybody be sad if they have a heart ?
#Text=It ’s just that I ’ve seen so much .
#Text=In Taiwan , standing in a slaughterhouse for dogs .

#Text=You have to get through it , and to me , having foster-cared chickens ; I know if anyone took a chicken in the way they took a dog in they would come to love that chicken and come to see that chicken had personality .
#Text=That chicken would wait for you to come home in the evening .
#Text=They ca n’t laugh this off , because it ’s actually true !
#Text=Chickens develop bonds with people the same way dogs do .
#Text=They know you ’ve rescued them if you ’ve rescued them ; they ’ll sit on your lap while you ’re watching TV .
#Text=Having had those relationships it ’s just as hard for me to stand in a chicken slaughterhouse .
#Text=But if anyone had had those experiences they would feel the same way .
#Text=I think it ’s hard to pigeon-hole me as sad .
#Text=I ’m not .
#Text=I ’m joyous .
#Text=I did n’t see you as sad in that movie .
#Text=Oh really ?
#Text=Oh , good .
#Text=It ’s interesting you brought that up , because a thought I had watching the film is that people always find something to criticize with a person .
#Text=It ’s not , “ Okay , Ingrid just really loves animals and wants to help them ” but “ you ’re obsessed and sad . ”

#Text=If you were taking a $ 1,000,000 salary every year and driving around in a Mercedes , they would say , “ She ’s not really in it for the animals , she ’s completely stuffing her pockets with her cause . ”
#Text=But you are not doing that [ Newkirk earned $ 32,000 from PETA in 2005 ] and the film makes that clear ; so instead , the criticism is that you are sad and obsessed .
#Text=Right .
#Text=Thank you .
#Text=Thank you .
#Text=You ’re either milking it for all it is worth —
#Text=Or you are some weird ascetic .
#Text=What do you think drives people to jump at negative spin ?
#Text=It ’s human nature .
#Text=You see the thing at a silly level with celebrities .
#Text=They love them , and then they tear them down .
#Text=Or they are just salivating , hoping for somebody to trip and fall .
#Text=I think it ’s jut another nasty past of human nature .
#Text=Especially if you think somebody has done something that makes you a little guilty , it ’s very hard to overcome people ’s guilt .
#Text=I know I was the same way when somebody first suggested to me I should not eat animals .
#Text=I was quite defensive about it .
#Text=I remember that .
#Text=There are many other things along the way that I have had to fight out in my own head and get rid of the defensiveness .
#Text=I think people are defensive , and they do n’t want someone to tell them what to do .
#Text=They know a lot of their life is frivolous .
#Text=I had an assistant once who wanted to leave for the evening , and I said , “ Could you just finish this before you go home ? ”
#Text=and he said , “ I ’ve got a life ! ”
#Text=and I said , “ Yeah , me too , but mine does n’t consist of playing video games for five hours ! ” [ Laughs ] .
#Text=But as you get older I think your perspective might change and whatever drives you
#Text=it occurs you only have so much time , and you want to accomplish this .
